result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin R. Caldwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

Pay costs, surcharges and any assessments, on or before 09-16-2016.
Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin R. Caldwell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ADMINISTRATIVE STAY ALLOWING DEFENDANT UNTIL  12-16-2015   TO PAY FINE AND COSTS, GRANTED.
Signed and Filed, Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in Judgment of Conviction.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.
Court ordered Defendant to pay Restitution in the amount of $500.00 to the victim on or before 11-16-2015.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.  
Court ordered Defendant to pay costs, surcharges and any assessments on or before 09-16-2016.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

Defendant waived rights and pled NO CONTEST.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Defendant Kevin R. Caldwell in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. On motion of the State Court amended Count 1 from Criminal Damage to Property  TO  a County Ordinance Disorderly Conduct under Wisconsin Stats. 63.01.  Parties are prepared to proceed with a Projected Guilty Plea.

Defendant Kevin R. Caldwell in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 23 on 09/16/2015 at 8:30am. Defense counsel informs the Court that he also has another trial scheduled for that day with an in-custody defendant before Judge Rosa.  Defense counsel will keep the Court informed of his status on the trial date. Defendant reminded to follow all of the conditions of bail. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.

Defendant Kevin R. Caldwell in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps. Morgan Wilz appearing under the Student Practice Rules as supervised by Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. State revokes offer. Court ordered State to produce photos or documentation of no photos by the next court date.  All parties are advised effective August 3, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin R. Caldwell in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn for attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz with Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin R. Caldwell in court with attorney Anne Devitt Louis Edward Epps.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant has a pending felony set for jury trial on 7/22/2015 before Branch 7.  Defense requests a status conference on that same date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin R. Caldwell in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant qualifies for Public Defender representation.  Court orders case adjourned for pretrial conference and status of counsel to Branch 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin R. Caldwell in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 46 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/17/15 @ 1:30 pm
